title: House of Architecture
segmentation: Yes hello, my name is Kevin Oberhuber.
Anne, I'm from the House of Architecture in Gratz, in Austria.
I'm here today speaking to you on behalf of Fire Director Marcus Bones Burger, who can't be here today because we have a symposium taking place or accompanying our current exhibition free play.
But he will be here tomorrow in the afternoon and joining the tour.
Some of you will stay.
You will meet him there.
I will give you an insight into the activities of the Hardy R as we call it in Austria.
It's short for how static tour.
And tell you a little bit about the historic and local context we are situated in.
We are rather a small team, so as mentioned, Marcus Bones Burger is the artistic and managing director of the House.
Really Ocotal exit culture Alexis is responsible for exhibitions and public relations.
Patrons towards our accountant and I'm doing project coordination and I'm responsible together with Marcus for the future future architecture platform.
We have like 8 students, architectural students, master students who are working also for us building up exhibitions lectures.
Doing tours also guard our exhibitions in the weekends and are at the bar when we have openings or lectures.
First of all I wanted to show you where the city of grass is located.
As you can see on the map gratis the same distance from Vienna shows our capital.

Of course to SAC Rep and Ljubljana which a circle with a diameter of 200 kilometers indicates this position of Kratz in the southeast of of Austria has resulted to numerous networks to institutions and architectural scenes in countries such as Slovenia and Croatia.
Grass is the city of architecture.
It has 280,000 inhabitants counting in the agglomeration.
There are 400 and thousand.
We have a high number of architecture office and really a lot of students of architecture 2100.
In
1999 Gratz was mentioned or declared as UNESCO World Cultural Heritage Site.
The city is a blend of historic styles such as Roman Gothic, Baroque and Renaissance, but was also recognized by UNESCO for its high quality in modern architecture.
In 2003 Grads became a European capital of culture.
Between 1963 and the beginning of the 1990s, Gratz was the location of a BI annual called Trygon, showing art of three countries, Austria, Italy and former Yugoslavia.
In the end of the 60s, Tregan featured a number of very avantgarde architectural approaches.
On the left you can see a part of the exhibition architecture by two well known architects from Gratz, Gunter, Dominique, and Alfred Hoot, which they created for the 1967 edition of the BI Annual.
The image on the right shows supposed cardby superstudio from the biennial from 69, which focused especially on architecture.

Also the famous festival you may know stylish helps distinguish it's Tyrion falls during autumn was also founded in the late 1960s and is the oldest multidisciplinary festival for contemporary art in Europe.
It includes visual art, architecture, performances, theater literature, new music, so click see in the lakes and 60s.
Bratz was an important place for new ideas and artistic development.
In architecture, the Avant garde approach approaches of the late 1960s were developed further, leading to number of extraordinary buildings.
For example, the residential complex.
Altera somehow siedlung Viveca pick rats from 1978, which you can see in the central image on the top.
Also in the 1980s were a time of experiments and innovation in Gratz, with a dynamic architectural seen, the term school Grad School of Architecture was born in that time.
These developments led to the formation of the House of Architecture as the first of its kind in Austria, and so now we have 9.
So in every.
Providence in Austria.
There is one of its kind.
The House of Architecture was founded in 1988 as a nonprofit organization focusing on promoting architecture and high quality building culture.
It works within the context of culture, social policy, education, policy and economy.

We pursue the following aims to provide a platform for all branches of architecture, Urban Development and spatial planning to act in the interests interests of different social crew groups to cooperate with related disciplines.
To act as a point of contact for all matters regarding building culture, we see ourselves as a thematic platform.
Does it?
That is open for all interested persons.
It was found.
Goodbye the town of Gratz, the country of Syria, the Chamber of Architects, the Technical University grads, the Austrian Architects Association, and the Forum.
Step back, which is also multidisciplinary.
Cultural institution.
These major players are in the Board of the Hardy as since 1988, and still so we have like 7 members from these institutions.
An one member is in our board.
It's free, free member who get elected every two years or every three years, sorry.
For the first 20 years, the House of Architecture was located in an old big mansion, was not in the center of the town, and in 2008 we move.
To the inner city, right to the famous concepts.
Kratz by Peter Cook and College Uni, which was opened in 2003 when Grass was through European capital of Culture.
The new location provides less space but letter twice as many visitors.

The so called political felt which you see here from the early 18th century weather has located was River to lies by the Berlin architectural Studio E. Fall short for Institute for Applied Urbanism and Yes Coffees A in 2008.
So in 2008 we moved into the polyam we occupied ahold ground floor and sometimes also do lectures and workshops, and on the 2nd floor at the moment.
Unfortunately there is a.
Children's Festival Office is located inside, but we hope to get it back next year and yeah.
These are our exhibition spaces lecture spaces.
Oh sorry.
And Bar area, but it's not as clean anymore as you see it on this pictures from 2008.
The broad range is covered by the Hardy.
I includes exhibition as I mentions up to publications in 2014.
We really had a record of visitors like 16,000 and 500.
We made 10 exhibitions, exhibitions for example about 2 apart while accreditor in Paris, which was created by Andreas Antique Aruban Super Super Fantastic.

Who are here also today and for example also young photographer from Austria David Shriya, who made photographs from Dominique Buildings, the traveling exhibition actually was in Nuremberg in Germany already and opens next week in in in in stroke control where 12 workshops swell with children, also with students excursions.
For example, years ago went to Eritrea in Asmara or this year to to Milano to see the Expo and.
Oscar Atiqullah things like that.
We had eight books, presentations, publications and every two years the days of architecture take place.
Here are some publications we make every three years.

The government of Syria, the country of stereo gives the architectural price of architecture where you can apply and in years ago they decided not to have a jury to select the price just to have one creator who does it.
So the first time it was Andreas Ruby who is here today.
Second time was about as Adam and the third time was Natalie Defreese from NVR DV and we also accompanying this.
Price is a book called yearbook.
Um?
The House of Architecture also takes instead stands in issues of building policy and the revelation of laws and regulations.
In 2015, we launched the first summer of architecture in Gratson Sterea.
More than 200 events took place, such as exhibitions, lectures, tours.
Um artists, artistic actions and discussion.
The aim was to encourage a broad public to create new perspectives on our everyday surroundings and import.
An important aspect was the opening up towards a number of local organisations and external players.
These were invited to contribute to the program which was framed and hosted by the House of Architecture.
We made.
Of course the home page and the little pocket book you can see afterwards if you want where we just collected.
The whole program and just can go through through through city of graphs and just look around what was happening in the summer.
Although the exact numbers of visitors are still in evaluation, and when we talked first to our two to several institutions, architect students, everybody was like great idea.
But in summer, maybe it's there are less with visitors, but I can tell that it was really, really well received on the images.
You can see the range of events which goes from lectures, children's workshops, film screening, student workshops and socially, whence of preopening.
For example, we had like 1000 people in the House of Architecture.
So finally I show you a view of our current exhibition called Free Play dealing with Break playgrounds in urban planning, where we have a symposium today as I mentioned.
And yeah, that's it.
And I'm very looking forward to things together with you work together with you.
And yeah, thank you very much.
